task_summary: The robot opens the oven door by visually locating it, aligning, grasping the handle, pulling to open, verifying successful opening, and retreating.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves a robotic manipulator interacting with a toy kitchen oven. It must visually locate the oven door, approach and align its end effector to the handle, compute an appropriate grasp pose for pulling, then execute the pull motion to open the door. After confirming that the oven door is now open, the robot retreats from the workspace. All steps are visually monitored and performed in a precise manner to avoid collisions and ensure successful completion.
preconditions: Oven door is closed and reachable
Workspace is free of unexpected obstacles
stepwise_plan: Locate oven door using visual detection
Approach and align to oven door handle
Pull oven door open to target distance
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect oven door: retry detection
Unstable grasp: retry alignment and grasping
Door fails to open: retry pull, escalate failure if stuck
task_long_description.termination: After confirming that the oven door is open and the robot has retreated from the workspace

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if oven door is visible in the robot's sensor view.
Runs vision detector to localize oven door. Used if not initially visible.
Combines approach and orientation for precise alignment with oven handle.
Computes grasp pose for a pulling motion on oven door.
Executes grasp to hold oven door handle.
Pulls oven door open with 0.3 meters travel.
Confirms oven door has opened successfully.
Moves arm back from open oven for safety.

failure_modes: Insufficient pull force or travel distance
recovery_strategy: Retry visual detection if oven door lost
Repeat approach and grasp if necessary
Escalate error if oven door stuck after several attempts
assumptions: Instruction implies oven door is initially closed and can be opened; frames visually confirm robot arm starts at rest and approaches oven door.
No explicit grasp force is set due to lack of such port in the chosen action.
Assumed oven handle is part of oven door for grasp pose computation.
No human or other dynamic obstacles observed in frames.

expected_success_criteria: Oven door visibly open in final frames
Robot arm no longer obstructing workspace
